channel.title: Docs on Gabriele Sicuro
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on Gabriele Sicuro

item.title: Former and current students
item.description:
PhD students #

  • From 2021, Urte Adomaityte. King’s College London.
  • From 2025, Rodrigo Emilio Perez Ortiz. Alma Mater Università di Bologna.

Master students #

  • 2016, Matteo P. D’Achille. Thesis: On two assignment problems, co-supervised with Sergio Caracciolo, University of Milan.
  • 2018, Gianmarco Perrupato. Thesis: Study of matching on the Bethe lattice, co-supervised with Giorgio Parisi, Sapienza University of Rome.
  • 2021, Anshul Toshniwal. Thesis: The planted multi-index matching problem, co-supervised with Lenka Zdeborová, EPFL.
  • 2021, Claudia De Sousa Miranda Perez. Thesis: The random dimer covering problem on the weighted Aztec graph, King’s College London.
  • 2021, Daniel Reti. Thesis: Robustness of excitations in the random dimer model, King’s College London.
  • 2021, Hugo Ryder. Thesis: Matching recovery, King’s College London.
  • 2021, Leonardo Scialo. Thesis: Arctic region in the weighted random dimer covering, King’s College London.
  • 2022, Guoyu Chang. Thesis: The mixed multi-index matching problem, King’s College London.
  • 2022, Xiaoying Zhou. Thesis: Statistical physics of community detection, King’s College London.
  • 2023, Wenjuan Li. Thesis: Stable Marriage Problems: Perturbations and Correlations, King’s College London.

Bachelor students #

  • 2024, Sara Tramontano. Thesis: Inferenza nel modello spiked Wigner in alta dimensione, University of Bologna.
  • 2025, Nora Riccobelli Carletti. Thesis: Proprietà spettrali di matrici casuali con applicazioni al machine learning, University of Bologna.
  • 2026, Adele Cornaglia. Thesis: TBA, University of Bologna.
